visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a stacked column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Stacked Column Chart', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the title and labels, with a font size of 14px for the title and 12px for the labels, Data series: Two stacks of data series with the provided data, Custom colors: Use a specific list of colors for the series - ['#7cb5ec', '#434348', '#90ed7d', '#f7a35c'], Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color (#f0f0f0), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a stacked column chart with the specified settings. The chart type is set to 'column', and the title is styled with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The x-axis and y-axis labels are styled with the same dark blue color and a font size of 12px. The chart displays two stacks of data series, each with its own set of data points and a specific color from the provided list. The chart background is set to a light gray color, and the legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to ensure sufficient spacing around the chart.
